botanical_details.genus: Lilium are bulbous perennials with erect stems bearing whorled or spirally arranged leaves and terminal racemes or umbels of bowl-shaped, trumpet-shaped, funnel-shaped or turks cap shaped flowers, often fragrant, and white, yellow, orange or red
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Division Ia lilies are early flowering Asiatic hybrids with alternate leaves and upright funnel-shaped flowers

how_to_grow.cultivation: Plant bulbs in autumn, 15cm deep, in moist but well-drained soil enriched with leaf mould or well-rotted organic matter. Grow on in full sun or partial shade in a sheltered position; for further information see Lilies: growing in containers
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by division; detach bulblets when the leaves die down and the plant becomes dormant
how_to_grow.pruning: No pruning required but deadhead to improve appearance
how_to_grow.pests: May be affected by lily beetles, slugs, snails, thrips and leatherjackets; plants grown in containers may be affected by vine weevil
how_to_grow.diseases: May be affected by lily disease, other fungal diseases and virus; see lily diseases for further information
